title: How to Make No‐Bake Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies

steps.headline: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set it aside.
Combine the butter or margarine, 1/2 cup of milk, 2 cups sugar, and 1/2 cup cocoa in a large three-quart saucepan.
Place the pan over medium heat and stir the ingredients constantly until the mixture comes to a full rolling boil.
Boil the mixture for exactly one minute and then remove it from the heat.
steps.description: Timing is very important in this recipe.

steps.headline: Stir in 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract, 1/2 cup of peanut butter (optional), and 3 cups of quick/minute oats.
Drop a spoonful of the batter onto the cookie sheet.
Refrigerate the cookies for an hour to 90 minutes before serving.

text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set it aside.  Combine the butter or margarine, 1/2 cup of milk, 2 cups sugar, and 1/2 cup cocoa in a large three-quart saucepan.  Place the pan over medium heat and stir the ingredients constantly until the mixture comes to a full rolling boil.  Boil the mixture for exactly one minute and then remove it from the heat. Timing is very important in this recipe. Stir in 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract, 1/2 cup of peanut butter (optional), and 3 cups of quick/minute oats. Mix everything together well. Drop a spoonful of the batter onto the cookie sheet.  Refrigerate the cookies for an hour to 90 minutes before serving.
